content.title: One Leg Donkey Calf Raise Instructions

items: Stand on one leg with your toes on the edge of a step or raised surface.
Lower your heel down as far as you can without losing balance.
Raise your heel up as high as you can, contracting your calf muscle.
Hold for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower your heel back down and repeat for desired number of reps.
Switch legs and repeat the exercise.

content.title: One Leg Donkey Calf Raise Form & Visual
One Leg Donkey Calf Raise Benefits

items: Strengthens and tones the calf muscles
Targets the soleus muscle, which is often neglected in traditional calf exercises
Can be done with minimal equipment and in a small space
Can be easily modified for different fitness levels by adjusting the weight or using a support
